alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 17 at 4:29AM EDT until September 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...A high risk for rip currents. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surf conditions. Breaking waves of 3 to 4 ft and long period swell will result in a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/11 AM 3.4 0.6 0.5 1 NONE 17/11 PM 2.7 -0.1 0.1 1 NONE 18/11 AM 3.1 0.3 0.2 1-2 NONE 19/12 AM 2.9 0.1 0.4 1-2 NONE 19/12 PM 3.4 0.6 0.4 1-2 NONE 20/12 AM 2.8 0.0 0.4 1 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/10 AM 3.5 0.6 0.3 2 NONE 17/10 PM 2.6 -0.3 -0.2 2 NONE 18/11 AM 3.3 0.4 0.1 1-2 NONE 18/11 PM 3.0 0.1 0.3 2 NONE 19/11 AM 3.4 0.5 0.2 2 NONE 20/12 AM 2.8 -0.1 0.2 1-2 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/11 AM 3.2 0.5 0.5 1 NONE 17/11 PM 2.7 0.0 0.3 1 NONE 18/12 PM 3.0 0.3 0.2 1 NONE 19/12 AM 3.0 0.3 0.7 1 NONE 19/12 PM 3.3 0.6 0.5 1 NONE 20/12 AM 2.8 0.1 0.6 1 NONE COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/09 AM 3.9 0.2 0.1 4 NONE 17/10 PM 3.2 -0.5 -0.2 3-4 NONE 18/10 AM 3.8 0.1 -0.1 3 NONE 18/10 PM 3.7 0.0 0.4 3 NONE 19/11 AM 4.2 0.5 0.3 3 NONE 19/11 PM 3.3 -0.4 0.2 3 NONE &&
info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times.
